availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Milton A. Vaughn (Green County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, farmer. Green County, Kentucky, native. Son of Fielding Vaughn, Sr., and Eliza Gum Vaughn. Married to Elizabeth Ann Williams Vaughn in Green County, Kentucky, in December 1851. Father of Woodson W. Vaughn. Married to Mary Anderson Penick Vaughn in Green County, Kentucky, in September 1859. Father of Anne M. Vaughn and Elvira A. Vaughn. Stepfather of Franklin Penick and William O. Penick. Resident of Green County in 1850. Household owned twenty-nine enslaved persons in Green County in 1850. Farmer in Green County in 1860. Owned twenty-one enslaved persons in Green County in 1860. Held an additional eleven enslaved persons in trust for Franklin Penick and William O. Penick in Green County in 1860.
